Description:
Detects executables located in potentially suspicious directories initiating network connections towards file sharing domains.

Author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Network Communication Initiated To File Sharing Domains From Process Located In Suspicious Folder
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((initiated = 'true' and (dst_host like '%.githubusercontent.com' or dst_host like '%anonfiles.com' or dst_host like '%cdn.discordapp.com' or dst_host like '%ddns.net' or dst_host like '%dl.dropboxusercontent.com' or dst_host like '%ghostbin.co' or dst_host like '%glitch.me' or dst_host like '%gofile.io' or dst_host like '%hastebin.com' or dst_host like '%mediafire.com' or dst_host like '%mega.co.nz' or dst_host like '%mega.nz' or dst_host like '%onrender.com' or dst_host like '%pages.dev' or dst_host like '%paste.ee' or dst_host like '%pastebin.com' or dst_host like '%pastebin.pl' or dst_host like '%pastetext.net' or dst_host like '%pixeldrain.com' or dst_host like '%privatlab.com' or dst_host like '%privatlab.net' or dst_host like '%send.exploit.in' or dst_host like '%sendspace.com' or dst_host like '%storage.googleapis.com' or dst_host like '%storjshare.io' or dst_host like '%supabase.co' or dst_host like '%temp.sh' or dst_host like '%transfer.sh' or dst_host like '%trycloudflare.com' or dst_host like '%ufile.io' or dst_host like '%w3spaces.com' or dst_host like '%workers.dev')) and (process_path like '%:\$recycle.bin%' or process_path like '%:\perflogs\%' or process_path like '%:\temp\%' or process_path like '%:\users\default\%' or process_path like '%:\users\public\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\fonts\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\ime\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\system32\tasks\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\tasks\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\temp\%' or process_path like '%\appdata\temp\%' or process_path like '%\config\systemprofile\%' or process_path like '%\windows\addins\%'))
